name: Casa Del Mar Hotel Jambiani

reviews.title: Paradise in Jambiani
reviews.text: We stayed at Casa del Mar in Jambiani for nearly two weeks in August. We had the most amazing time and couldn't have wished for nicer hosts. We looked at other places on this stretch of coast and this was by far and away the nicest and best value for money. Everything was beautifully made and presented, the food fresh and delicous and the staff friendly and welcoming. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking to escape for a while and stay in a little piece of paradise.
A little bit of paradise: wonderful place, very kind people, good food, big and clean rooms.
reviews.title: Magic
Great Resort But Terrible, Musty Room
reviews.text: All the very positive reviews about this place are correct. This is a lovely resort: relaxed, amazing beach, gorgeous pool, terrific restaurant, and a very charming village (be sure to have a meal at the original Kim's: have the legendary fish samosas). However, our room was truly miserable, and that made a big difference to our stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has three buildings with rooms. Two of these buildings form the main part of the hotel, but there's a smaller building near the hotel entrance that has two rooms. We were in this smaller building. It was a bit of a nightmare.
reviews.title: Original and friendly beachfront place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, there is no cross ventilation at all, and it is very musty and damp. Nothing can dry in the room, and we couldn't get rid of the smell.
reviews.title: Very Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Second, the windows have no bug screens. You have to keep the windows open to try and at least get some fresh air into the room. The result is some serious mosquito infestation. We were badly bitten every night for three nights, despite the bed nets.
reviews.title: Character and Quality

reviews.text: Third, the shower leaks water everywhere, which then adds to the damp.
reviews.title: great little hotel

reviews.text: Casa del Mar is an exquisite refuge from the generic sea side resorts of the world. Here, instead of noisy generators running air conditioning, the quiet of the ceiling fans allows for the sound of the surf to lull you to sleep. I chose to stay in Zanzibar in order to recover from my climb of Kilimanjaro; it turned out to be a lovely destination on its own. The staff really is like family (the good kind). If I lived in Europe, instead of California (20 hours air time), I would return regularly.
reviews.title: exquisite refuge

reviews.text: This was the best part of a very long journey to Tanzania. I loved the rest of the trip, but this topped it off in a spectacular manner. First of all, the wonderful people who own and run Casa Del Mar are so kind and sweet. They made certain that we were comfortable and had everything we needed for our stay. I agree that it was 7 star service as one of the other posters had so perfectly put it. I was ill for part of the time and they often inquired, recommended a doctor and gave me over the counter medicine to ease my symptoms. We also had some money issues and they were so great. We just wired the money from home. We didnt like having to do this, but their kindess and trust meant the world to us weary travelers. No worries. The rooms were spacious and cool with strong showers. The meals were the best I had my entire time in Tanzania. The Seafood Dish was spectacular and the kitchen/ wait staff were wonderful. They really paid attention to detail. All of this and the most beautiful ecru colored beaches and clear aqua water. We walked out into the water a good 300 yards and were stlll pretty much in knee to waist deep water with a clear view of the sand beneath our feet. It was one of the most beautiful beaches I have had the pleasure to visit. I still dream of it. The hand built sail boats were lovely to watch lazily moving their way accross the horizon. I cant wait to return. My friends took advantage of a nice trek into Stonetown and the Spice Tour. They really seemed to enjoy it. I couldnt leave the beach, the water and Casa Del Mar. A slice of Heaven on Earth. Very romantic at night as well, as the moon refects off the light colored sand and gives everything a glow. The water is warm and you can easily take a dip at night. Worth the hour and a half drive from the Airport. There are other little places to stay beachside, but you hardly notice them this time of year. I loved this place!
reviews.title: WOW!!! What a great place to stay, so beautiful.

likes.liked: — The owners adn employees, the spacious clean rooms, the views, the dining, the beach and water.

reviews.text: I have just completed my stay in Jambiani, Zanzibar. Have stayed for 4 nights at Casa Del Mar. This place is really awesome in many ways.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Jambiani

reviews.text: To begin, the hotel was corresponding back & forth with me before I even step foot in ZNZ. This is a plus esp. for one who has not been to ZNZ hence may have queries. And then the adventure .. my luggage didn’t arrive with me from Khartoum due to some geographical mess up. So I was upset & cranky knowing that I may have to make a few 1 hr 15 mins trip back to the ZNZ airport to retrieve my luggage. The superb thing is that Salim (the owner) met me at ZNZ airport and told me he would sort it out with the airport authorities by getting my luggage for me so that I could continue straight to Jambiani instead of waiting for few hours for a luggage that might/might not show up (luggage showed up 3 hours after the promised time).
reviews.title: Definitely the best charming hotel in the Jambiani district

reviews.text: The journey from the airport to the hotel took 1hr 15 mins because the road condition is bad half way through. Once arriving at the hotel, I was greeted by Mediha (Salim’s wife) who showed me the room & told me where to find the restaurant. I thing to note, Mediha has excellent instinct when to let me be and when to suggest something .. letting me find the restaurant myself was great as I get to ease my crankiness whilst I get to explore at the same time. Food at the restaurant was excellent; I had mixed seafood salad as starters & grilled king fish as main with Casa Mix (in-house non-alcoholic cocktail). The restaurant paid attention to detail well, staff was friendly, helpful & maintain high standard. Warning to small eaters – portions are huge, every course is served with salad. At the same time, you may suggest something not on the menu and the restaurant shall try to accommodate. Alcohol is not served in the hotel however guest may BYO.
reviews.title: Paradise on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa del Mar is a charming small hotel on an exquisite stretch of beach with a relaxing untouristy atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and clean with imaginative hand crafted furniture and have individual patio areas. The hotel is set in a lovely garden and screened beach area with comfortable lounge chairs and hammocks. There is no pool, but you can swim at high or low tide. Swimming at low tide was magical. We walked out across flats of shimmering white sand, shallow tidal pools and beds of cultivated seaweed to a vast expanse of white sand and crystal clear turquoise water.
reviews.title: Idyllic beach holiday
Hotel Casa Del Mar
reviews.text: Casa del Mar has a lovely restaurant under a thatched pavilion, with excellent food and service. They do not sell liquor, but they make delicious fruit juices or you can go to the bar of the hotel next door for beer and wine (or plan ahead and byo). They do not object to you bringing it back to consume in their restaurant. There are a couple of small bars along the beach with a definitely laid back atmosphere and fun places to have a drink.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Casa del Mar were friendly, competent and helpful. They arranged the airport transfers and a snorkeling trip, and indulged my efforts to speak Swahili.
reviews.title: Never again - we left after one night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I loved our stay at Casa del Mar and did not experience any of the problems described in some other reviews. I had been to Zanzibar before and stayed at a larger “luxury” resort, but preferred the ambience of this hotel. I feel it reflects a philosophy of low-impact tourism and respect for the local community.
reviews.title: building work next door smelly bathrooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Zanzibar after a safari and a trip to Mt Kenya, so we where looking for a place to relax and sunbath.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fabulous!

aka: Casa Del Mar Hotel Jambiani Zanzibar
description: Our 14 rooms are located in two buildings. All rooms have sea view and are tastefully decorated and equipped with East African art and furniture built from eco-friendly local materials. The eight rooms on the ground floor have bathrooms with shower & WC and a private balcony. The six second floor suites are all double-story with a spacious living room, bathroom and balcony on the first level, and with a king-size futon bed with mosquito net under the thatched roof. For families, additional beds can be placed on the first level. All rooms have ceiling fans. Casa del Mar has its own emergency generator, as electricity blackouts are not unusual in Zanzibar. Furthermore, we have invested in a 60,000 liters underground freshwater tank with three powerful water pumps, providing the rooms with hot and cold water.
